title: Reproducing / Validating Tiny-YoloV3 in Inference mode
body:
## The config. and weights file with respect to YoloV3-Tiny does not seem to reproduce the MAP accuracy (for IoU: 0.5:0.95) as listed in the table on the github site (https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3). Is there a specific set of settings to determine the MAP accuracy for IoU-> 0.5..0.95?
(Note: Rest all the default parameter settings were used. Desired image size is 416 x 416)

## While analyzing the object-detection networks I endeavor to first reproduce some of the tabulated mAP-results published at the github site: https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3 by using the latest cloned repository from this site.
However, while I could generate almost identical mAP results against the “YoloV3-SPP-Ultralytics” network through the command: $ python3 test.py --cfg yolov3-spp.cfg --weights yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt –img-size 640 –augment, when compared with the screenshot on the github site; the same was not entirely true for some of the other networks, for which the comparison is made with the tabulated results.
In particular, I have the following queries towards obtaining the mAP accuracy against other networks:
1.	As per the tabulated mAP figures for Tiny-YoloV3 (@ image-size 416), the expected mAP with IoU:0.5 is 0.33, and the same for IoU: 0.5:0.95 is 0.16. Using the COCO-2014 dataset, I could closely obtain the expected accuracy with IoU -> 0.5 (using IoU-Thresh of 0.5), but I am unsure of the specific configuration required to obtain mAP against IoU -> 0.5:0.95. In this respect the github site states using an IoU-Thresh of 0.7, but this did not result in the expected accuracy figures. 
[The command executed was: $ python3 test.py --cfg yolov3-tiny.cfg --weights yolov3-tiny.pt –img-size 416 –iou-thres 0.7 . Please note that the rest of config settings are based on the default settings of the parameters, e.g. conf-thres -> 0.001]
2.	Is it required to adjust “Conf-Thresh” argument along with the “IoU-Thresh”, in order to achieve the expected results, for different IoU ranges? Can we fix the “IoU-Thresh” and “Conf-Thresh” settings and still generate the Average-Precision and Average-Recall for different ranges of IoUs?
3.	The github site states a different log data than what gets currently displayed; instead of the detailed overall stats for different IoU ranges, I obtained individual class-wise precision figures, for all the 80 classes of COCO-dataset. Is there a mechanism to generate the overall Average Precision and Average Recall logs as stated on the github site?
4.	Lastly, I believe the column-title mAP@0.5 is just a fixed / pre-defined label irrespective of whether the accuracy-value corresponds to IoU @ 0.5 or IoU @ 0.5:0.95.. could this be confirmed?
